clinical_study.brief_title: Fronto-limbic Functional Connectivity Via Real-time fMRI Neurofeedback
clinical_study.official_title: Voluntary Regulation of Fronto-limbic Functional Connectivity: A Proof-of-concept Real-time fMRI Study

lead_sponsor.agency: University of Electronic Science and Technology of China

clinical_study.source: University of Electronic Science and Technology of China

brief_summary.textblock: Real-time fMRI neurofeedback training induced volitional control of brain activity and connectivity could help individuals to gain better control over their emotions.

detailed_description.textblock: In the present proof-of-concept study, investigators plan to evaluate whether real-time fMRI neurofeedback training can enable individuals to gain volitional control over their fronto-limbic circuitry. Given that this circuitry has been abundantly implicated in emotional perception and regulation this could facilitate emotional control. Suitable participants underwent fronto-limbic connectivity feedback training and sham training in a cross over design. During both trainings participants are instructed to regulate the neural indices during feedback. We expect that receiving fronto-limbic feedback enhances emotion regulation during the training.

primary_outcome.measure: Training-induced changes in emotion related processing
primary_outcome.description: The scores of visual analogue scale assessing individuals' anxiety level will be compared between before and after training within each group as well as between twe groups after training

arm_group.description: Neurofeedback training - neurofeedback of fronto-limbic functional connectivity.
Sham training - feedback that is not related with fronts-limbic connectivity (motor connectivity)

intervention.intervention_name: Real-time fMRI neurofeedback from Turbo Brain voyager (TBV) 3.2

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy subjects without past or current psychiatric or neurological disorders
Exclusion Criteria:
- pregnant, taking oral contraceptives
